Exaggerate: The claim suggests that there is "much more going on" regarding COVID-19 than meets the eye, implying that there is a hidden agenda or conspiracy behind the virus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the timing of the coronavirus outbreak is suspicious because it coincided with President Trump beating an impeachment trial and being up for re-election.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support for the assertion that there is something larger driving the outbreak.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Trey Gowdy did not make the statement attributed to him. Gowdy himself clarified that the post was fraudulent and misinformation.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misattributing a statement to Trey Gowdy, leading to a false narrative being spread.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the timing of the coronavirus outbreak, instead suggesting a conspiracy related to Trump and China.
